title: Blended Instructional Design for Foreign Language Teachers' Digital Literacy Competency

context.prior_knowledge: Basic foreign language education theory and computer literacy (Word, PPT, etc.)
context.additional_context: Practical IT Literacy Development Using Virtual Learning Environments (e.g., OpenSim) and Constructivist Teaching Methods

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three strategies for utilizing information technology tools (e.g., virtual world platforms, collaborative software) in foreign language education contexts.
Learners can apply the three presences (cognitive, teaching, and social) of the Community of Inquiry (CoI) framework to design virtual learning activities based on constructivist pedagogy.
Learners can implement foreign language class simulations using low-cost virtual environments (e.g., OpenSim, Sloodle) and evaluate learning outcomes.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Padlet, Google Workspace, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
